name: SilisiumTech
description: SilisiumTech, Inc. is a Carnegie Mellon University (CMU) spinoff who’s mission is to rebuild and decarbonize the US Solar supply chain. Last year the solar industry shrunk by 16% because of the dependencies on China where 97% of all silicon wafers are produced; tariffs, circumvention of the tariffs, and forced labor practices have created a volatile industry.  Our inventor and CTO has been working on this problem for the last 10 years with $5M in grant funding from DOE, NSF, and others.  He has developed a process to make silicon wafers on a continual bases which will cut the cost of today’s manually produced wafers in half and produce half as much CO2 - if all silicon wafers were produced with this continuous process, we would prevent 1,420 metric tons of GHG from being produced annually. This work led to SilisiumTech winning Rounds 1 and 2 in the DOE Made in America Solar Prize, generated two patents, being accepted into the Gener8tor Sustainability accelerator, and winning a spot in the Clean Tech Open.

company_updates_collection.description: I am very excited to announce that SilisiumTech has received it's first investment!  We are now part of gener8tors Sustainability Accelerator https://lnkd.in/eTfh3pGS
This is huge........Driven by solar, California’s net demand hit zero on Sunday https://lnkd.in/exU9Cs7s

SilisiumTech is working to rebuild the US solar supply chain by producing a silicon wafer for solar modules that are half the cost and generates half the greenhouse gas emissions in production.   This is an interesting pv magazine USA article about solar's capability.

SilisiumTech, Inc. is working to rebuild the US Solar supply chain by focusing on the critical silicon wafer production in the US.  This wouldn't be possible if the other parts of the supply chain weren't investing in the US as well.  Our potential customers have announced expansions or new production capacity at an incredible rate, In the last 12 months, the US has seen 52 new solar facilities or expansions announced.  Here is an article that goes deeper documenting the effect of the Inflation Reduction Act (IRA).

SEIA: solar and storage has added US$100 billion to US economy following Inflation Reduction Act
https://lnkd.in/gZj9yVEa
